meanings.definition: Relating to or consisting of phyllomes.
meanings.sent1: The phyllomic structure of the plant leaves was fascinating to study.
meanings.sent2: The botanist examined the phyllomic features of the flower carefully.
meanings.sent3: The phyllomic patterns on the leaves looked like tiny green puzzles.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork was as intricate and detailed as a phyllomic design.
meanings.sent5: The phyllomic characteristics of the tree made it stand out in the forest.

meanings.sent1: The phyllomic changes in the plant's structure were noticeable after the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The scientist discussed the phyllomic properties of the new species.
meanings.sent3: The phyllomic details on the stem were like nature's own decorations.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a phyllomic wonderland of colors and shapes.
meanings.sent5: The phyllomic adaptations of the plant helped it thrive in different environments.

meanings.definition: Having the characteristics of a phyllome.
meanings.sent1: The phyllomic appearance of the petals added beauty to the flower.
meanings.sent2: The textbook explained the phyllomic nature of the plant's reproductive organs.
meanings.sent3: The phyllomic structure of the leaf made it look like a delicate fan.
meanings.sent4: Her dress was a phyllomic masterpiece of floral patterns.
meanings.sent5: The phyllomic features of the plant were essential for its survival in the wild.
